segments.text: I see the girl standing there, her hand reaching up like she’s asking for something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so hopeful, like she’s waiting for the boy to share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s the younger one, always relying on her brother to get what she wants.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s not even touching the stool, just standing there patiently.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s smart to stay back, but I also feel a little sad for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so trusting, like she knows he’ll give her a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn’t drop the plate and ruin everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way she’s looking up at him is so sweet, like he’s her hero.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but smile at how innocent she seems.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just a little kid, and she doesn’t even realize how dangerous this is.
segments.speaker: PAR
